executiveSummary: Entrepreneurs Ky and Max from Philadelphia pitched the Chompsaw, a child-safe cardboard cutting tool, seeking $250,000 for 5% equity. After demonstrating its safety and explaining strong preorder sales totaling $2.1 million, they secured a joint investment deal from Mark Cuban and Lori Greiner for $250,000 in exchange for 15% equity.
keyDecisions: Ky and Max accepted a joint offer from Mark Cuban and Lori Greiner of $250,000 for 15% equity in their company.

actionItems.task: Oversee final production test run of 1,000 units in China
Begin shipping preordered Chompsaw units to customers
Explore retail opportunities once inventory is available

nextSteps: Ky and Max will finalize manufacturing in China, begin fulfilling preorders, and work with Mark Cuban and Lori Greiner to refine pricing, scale marketing, and expand retail distribution.
